subject: Programming
title: Confirmation Bias in Debugging
description: A fast breakdown of Confirmation Bias in Debugging for builders.

hook.text: You're sure the bug is in the database layer. You spend hours there. It was in the frontend all along.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias makes you seek evidence that supports your theory and ignore evidence against it.

discovery.text: Programmers often debug by testing their hypothesis instead of trying to disprove it.

twist.text: The fix: actively try to prove yourself wrong. Write a test that should pass if your theory is correct.

climax.text: Scientific debugging â€” forming hypotheses and testing them â€” beats intuition-driven guessing every time.

punchline.text: Try to prove yourself wrong first.

quiz.question: How does confirmation bias affect debugging?
options: You only look for evidence supporting your theory
You fix bugs faster than normal
You always find the correct root cause
